entry.title: Tokyo X Erotica (2001)
entry.content:
Tokyo X Erotica (2001)

What lasts longer, the time before birth or the time after death? In the 1990’s, Kenjo (Ishikawa Yuichi) dies in a terrorist gas attack. His girlfriend Haruka (Sasaki Yumeka) is killed by a man she meets as a street prostitute….

* AKA - shibireru kairaku

* Genre - Pinku Eiga (Pink Cinema), cyber punk extravaganza

* Year - 2001

* Director - Takahisa Zeze

* Country - Japan

* Audio - Japanese

* Subtitles - English

* Run Time - 77min

* imdb - http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0320641/

Cast

* Yuji Ishikawa

* Takeshi Ito

* Mayuko Sasaki

* Yumeko Sasaki

Synopsis

In the 1990’s Kenjo dies in a terrorist gas attack and his girlfriend, Haruka, is killed while doing her rounds as a prostitute. In 2002, the two of them meet up again…but how can this be possible when they are both dead?

entry.title: Untold Scandal (2003)
entry.content:
Untold Scandal (2003)

Based on the novel ‘Les Liaisons Dangereuses,’ this film is set in aristocratic 18th-century Korea at the end of the Chosun Dynasty. The irresistible temptress Lady Cho asks her cad of a younger cousin, Jo-won, to deflower the innocent young…

Joseon namnyeo sangyeoljisa Untold scandal, Scandal, The scandal (2003)

Combining bold erotica, historical detail, and eloquent tragedy, Untold Scandal roots Pierre Choderlos de Laclos’ Les Liaisons Dangereuses in 18th Century Korea. Previously set in pre-revolutionary France (Dangerous Liaisons) and in a wealthy New York prep school (Cruel Intentions), this version of the timeless Gallic tale of treachery, lust, and sacrifice may even be the best of the lot (The Los Angeles Times)

Year: 2003

Genre: Drama

Director:Lee Je-Yong

Cast:Bae Yong-jun, Lee Mi-Sook, Jo Hyeon-jae, Jeon Do-yeon

Country:South Korea

Language:Korean

Subtitles:English

Duration:124 mins

IMDB:http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0380689/

entry.title: Colour Blossums (2004)
entry.content:
Colour Blossoms (2004)

Photographer/filmmaker Yon Fan (Bishonen, Peony Pavilion) trains his celebrated eye on five disparate individuals in his controversial erotic drama Colour Blossoms. Teresa Cheung stars as a real estate agent drawn into a torrid - and sadomasochistic - relationship with a…

Colour Blossoms

* AKA - Tok Sik

* Genre - Asian Art house/Drama/S&M/Gay/Lesbian

* Year - 2004

* Director - Yonfan

* Country - Hong Kong

* Audio - Chinese (canto)

* Subtitles - English

* Run Time - 106min

* imdb - http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0436833/

Cast

* Teresa Cheung…Mei li

* Ri-su Ha…Riko Umeki (as Harisu)

* Feng Ku

* Keiko Matsuzaka…Madam Umeki

* Carl Ng…4708

* Sho …Kim

* Kenneth Tsang

Synopsis

One day, property agent Meili (Teresa Cheung) has two strange encounters; Madam Umeki (Matsuzaka Keiko), a mysterious Japanese high society lady who asks her to lease out a luxurious abandoned apartment on her behalf. On this fateful day, she also discovers the man of her dreams, policeman 4708 (Carl Ng). While Meili takes potential tenants to the apartment, she meets a young photographer, Kim (Sho). Whom she cannot help but fall in love with. Later, Meili is astonished to discover Kim was the ex-lover of the young Madam Umeki (Harisu). The complex relationship between the color blossoms develops to be even more intriguing

entry.title: Lost Paradise (1997)
entry.content:
Lost Paradise (1997)

The tragic tale of two lovers whose passion burns so intensely it destroys them.

Title: Shitsurakuen (Lost Paradise)

Year Released: 1997

Directed By: Yoshimitsu Morita

Running Time: 119 Minutes

Genre: Drama

Language: Japanese

IMDB Link: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0120120/

Review (taken from IMDB)

***Caution May or May not contain spoilers.***

It is really beautiful, every moment, every performance, every scene, natural and artistic,

yet so moving and striking to me that I really can not breathe in the end. There is

something deep in your soul, which you may never experience in your life. But when it

comes to you and you realize that, you jump at it, no matter what consumes, your job,

family, even your life.

The most amazing part of this movie is that, when I watch it, I know it is a very strong

and passionate one (I have read the original book and I adore it), but every step it takes

happens so natural and real that you feel it is just the fate and inevitable. It is not

just a romantic story about forbidden love, there is something deeper and more serious

inside, where is the real life and love in this modern, developed society? I have long

felt there is a aesthetic yet self-destructive tendency in many Japanese novels and movies,

just like and blossom of cherry flowers. This one provide another sample.

As usual Koji Yakusho, my favorite current male Japanese actor delivers a very convincing

performance. This is my first time to see Hitomi Kuroki. She plays exactly the character

in the book, sometimes even better and far beyond it. I do not know how to describe her

beauty and acting, it is too perfect, I really love her in this movie. If I were Sholchiro

Kuki, I would do everything to make her a happy and complete life.

I guess this movie is not the cup of tea for everyone. First of all, the story itself may

be controversial in some sense, going against the conventional moral values. Second, there

are quiet a lot sizzling sex scenes. I have to admit, some of them are very arousing and

erotic, but they are naturally beautiful with no pretense. To this point,the only

comparable movies I can remember are: Damage, The lover, and Unfaithful.

By the way I also would like to recommend the original book with the same title by the

renowned Japanese writer Junichi Watanabe. In my eyes, he is the counterpart of

D.H.Lawrence in Asia in that both can write sex in such a real and beautiful way.

Cast:

Kôji Yakusho … Shoichiro Kuki

Hitomi Kuroki … Rinko Matsubaro

Akira Terao … Kinugawa

Toshio Shiba … Haruhiko Matsubara

Tomoko Hoshino … Fumie Kuki (wife)

Yoshino Kimura … Chika (daughter)

Kazuya Kosaka … Suzuki

Morio Agata … Yokoyama

Kenjiro Ishimaru … Muramatsu

Chiaki Hara … Ms. Miyata

Kumija Kim … Midori (as Kumiko Kim

entry.title: Lover (2005)
entry.content:
Lover (2005)

Having first met today, the man and woman dash towards a one-day-long intimacy… Maybe it was just an accident to accept a proposal from a total stranger to go out for just one day for this “woman” who’s been dating…

Name: Aein (Lover)

Genre: Drama / Romance

Plot:

Sung Hyun Ah (The Scarlet Letter, Cello) her lover has never taken a dangerous risk in her life. She has been for seven years and is going to get married next month. One day she meets a handsome stranger, who asked her to spend one day with him. It might be a mistake to accept his proposal, but over the next day she will experience a level of excitement and intimacy, she has never experienced before, and this could change her life all of sudden.

Year: 2005

Country: South Korea

Language: Korean

Directed: Kim Tae-eun

Cast: Seong Hyeon-ah, Jo Dong-hyeok, Lee Jae-ho, Jang Dae-seong

Subtitles: English

Encoding: XviD/Mp3

entry.title: Yellow Flower (2002)
entry.content:
Yellow Flower (2002)

Lee Ji-sang’s Yellow Flower dramatizes the erogenous encounters of a group of Asian men and women, who explore the limits of their own sexuality by participating in deviant, perverse, and bizarre coital acts with one another. Like Nagisa Oshima’s In…

Okay first off you have to like naked Korean girls. Not just NKG but NKG who are well endowed and have great figures. We can’t rule out the gorgeous NKG’s in sexy lingerie and at times being hosed down while wearing that same lingerie. I’ve read several reviews of this film and I think that most ignorant viewers, more into Hollywood blockbusters would consider the 15 second scene 5 minutes into the film that is a little obscured and maybe dark - drew conclusions too early and didn’t bother to watch the rest of the film. Of course this is more time spent than blockheads who haven’t seen it and want to moan about the details of a torrent someone takes the time to upload. There are some scenes outdoors at night that are a little dark - but one expects that as opposed to unrealistic lighting. I am more impressed with the arthouse nature of this movie which is closer to a Kaurismï¿½ki “movie about nothing” than Star Wars. The editing of scenes are most notable - second of course to the nasty NKG’s. Oh yes the rampant erotic sex. Plenty of that also. A landmark film certain to be elevated some day to the same status as Metropolis, Ben Hur, Gone With The Wind and La Dolce Vita. review by subprimitive

Lee Ji-sang’s hardcore adult Korean film Yellow Flower dramatizes the erogenous encounters of a group of Asian men and women, who explore the limits of their own sexuality by participating in deviant, perverse, and bizarre coital acts with one another. Like Nagisa Oshima’s In the Realm of the Senses and Ryu Murakami’s Tokyo Decadence, Yellow Flower helped to obliterate the censorship of sexual content in motion pictures, throughout Asia. Jung Suh, Kim Jung-ki, and Jang Mi-ru co-star. (from allmovie)

Genre…………: Drama / Romance / Erotica

Distributor……: Attari
